summary: Payload converter errors when serializing incompatible objects (non-JSONifiable values, cyclic references) can crash the worker when they occur during error detail encoding in ApplicationError, unlike when they occur during activity response serialization.
userImpact: Workers can crash when activities throw ApplicationErrors with non-serializable details, making the system unreliable when buggy code passes invalid objects through error details.
rootCause: Payload converter throws UnsupportedEjsonTypeError during error detail encoding without being caught by the activity error handler, allowing the exception to escape Worker.run and crash the process.
keyQuote: If this happens when encoding e.g. the `details` of an `ApplicationError`, this error will escape the `Worker.run` and effectively crash the worker.
